title: Mario Kart 64!
text:
Introduction
what data set are you working with?
what variables are you most interested in?
How many observations are in your data set? - 2334 overall
what is your question of interest?
Which track is the fastest?
How did the world records develop over time? Which track is the fastest? For which track did the world record improve the most? For how many tracks have shortcuts been discovered? - 12 out of 16 tracks have shortcuts When were shortcuts discovered? On which track does the shortcut save the most time? Which is the longest standing world record? Who is the player with the most world records? Who are recent players?
where did you get the data from? (If possible, give a link to the data source).
Mario Kart World Records
github
what other pieces of context are important to explain to the reader?

title: Mario Kart 64!
text:
Primary Visualizations
choose an appropriate visualization, eliminate clutter, and focus attention as appropriate to answer your question of interest.
provide a written interpretation of each visualization you have, explaining what a reader should “take away” from each visualization.






records |> 
#  filter(shortcut == "Yes") |>
  group_by(track) |>
  summarise(n())

# A tibble: 16 × 2
   track                 `n()`
   <chr>                 <int>
 1 Banshee Boardwalk        83
 2 Bowser's Castle          69
 3 Choco Mountain          148
 4 D.K.'s Jungle Parkway   180
 5 Frappe Snowland         180
 6 Kalimari Desert         169
 7 Koopa Troopa Beach       89
 8 Luigi Raceway           147
 9 Mario Raceway           160
10 Moo Moo Farm             81
11 Rainbow Road            179
12 Royal Raceway           149
13 Sherbet Land            143
14 Toad's Turnpike         196
15 Wario Stadium           201
16 Yoshi Valley            160








records |> 
  filter(track == "Wario Stadium", time < 50) |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = time, color = shortcut)) +
  geom_point()

title: Mario Kart 64!
text:
Conclusion and Wrap-Up
are there any flaws with your approach to analyzing the data you’ve selected?
are there future directions you would go if you had additional data or more time?

title: Mario Kart 64!
text:
Connection to Class Ideas
At the end of your write-up, you should connect your visualization(s) to ideas from class. In what ways would you argue your visualization(s) are effective ways of communicating information?
